metadata.title: Wednesday, 27th November, 2013
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to revive the defunct Mansa Batteries Limited; and
(b)    if so, what the plans are.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    what the name of the contractor working on the Kalonga-Nyoka Road in Kasempa Parliamentary Constituency is;
(b)    how much money will be spent on the project at (a) above;
(c)    when the works on the Kasempa-Mukunashi Road will commence; and
(d)    which contractor has been selected to work on the road at (c) above. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W10    Mr Mutelo (Lukulu West) - to ask the Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs:
(a)    how many Chiefs are gazetted in Zambia, province by province;
(b)    when the Litunga of the Western Province was recognised as a Paramount Chief; and
(c)    why the Litunga is not addressed as His Majesty the King. W11    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Minister of Gender and Child Development:
(a)    how many women’s clubs were empowered in Chienge and Nchelenge Parliamentary Constituencies from September, 2011 to September, 2013;
(b)    what the names of the clubs are; and
(c)    what form of empowerment was provided:
(i)    if it was cash, how much was provided to each club; and (ii)    if it was equipment, what type of equipment was provided to each club.
